questions.question: Brent quickly left the party because

choices.answer: his ride was leaving.
he heard a police siren.
his curfew was 11:30.
he had fought with Chaz.

questions.question: Materials for the whirligigs Brent designed

choices.answer: were scorched by the campfire.
reminded him of his brother.
came from things he  found.
cost about $75.00.

questions.question: A problem Brent had while going home from the party was that

choices.answer: two boys were chasing him.
he heard a voice saying things.
the car radio was not working.
a tire on the car went flat.

questions.question: At the hotel in Florida, Brent

choices.answer: asked his parents to pick him up.
played video games.
went swimming after closing time.
left a note for the maid.

questions.question: "The breath of life" was the phrase that Brent thought of when

choices.answer: he watched his first whirligig operate.
he agreed to hike across the country.
he ran on the cross-country team.
he moved to the new school in Ohio.

questions.question: The fourteen-year old dishwasher stopped pretending to go to school when

choices.answer: his father saw him hiding in the garbage.
his counselor called his parents.
he gave his father money for the rent.
he learned all he needed to know.

questions.question: The street-sweeper thought that wherever there was a group of people

choices.answer: there was fighting.
they knew each other.
everyone was happy.
someone told jokes.

questions.question: To keep Raul from becoming ill, Constancia

choices.answer: gave him castor oil.
gave him vitamins.
fed him spinach everyday.
put candles over his crib.

questions.question: If the whirligig was destroyed by a hurricane, Brent knew others would appear because

choices.answer: he saw a boy practicing making a propeller.
he planned to return after the hurricane season.
he had left two extra ones with the fisherman.
he saw many for sale at the local flea market.

questions.question: The woman who painted told Brent that only someone________could have built such a whirligig.

choices.answer: who was a skilled carpenter.
whose life force was strong.
who had taken art lessons.
who knew how to use tools.

questions.question: At the end of the story, Brent thought

choices.answer: he would send money to the Zamora family.
he would live in New York City.
he would put his artwork in each state.
he would visit his friends in Atlanta.

questions.question: When he arrived at the party, Brent thought he had been tricked because

choices.answer: no one from school showed up except him.
he was the only guest without a gift.
it was a surprise party for his birthday.
everyone was wearing all black and white.

questions.question: Brent christened the whale whirligig by

choices.answer: singing a son.
playing a harmonica.
reciting a prayer.
writing a poem.

questions.question: At the bus station, two people

choices.answer: taught Brent how to play chess.
told Brent about a hardware store.
asked Brent if they could go with him.
tried to steal Brent's backpack.

questions.question: Because she had seen the results of fighting in the Philippines,

choices.answer: Mrs. Zamora studied to become a nurse.
Megan believed fighting solved problems.
Megan moved to the Philippines to help.
Mrs. Zamora didn't believe in restitution.

questions.question: To learn more about Lea, Brent

choices.answer: looked her up in an old yearbook.
invited her to a movie and dinner.
found a newspaper in the trash
talked to the high school principal.

questions.question: Jenny's grandmother looked at the whale whirligig

choices.answer: to remind her that people are good.
to remind her that she was once an artist.
to remind her that she loved the ocean.
to remind her that whales are endangered.

questions.question: The Zamoras replied to Brent's apology by

choices.answer: returning it to him in the mail.
writing him a note of forgiveness.
calling him on the telephone.
going to the mall to see him.

questions.question: Why did Mrs. Zamora ask Brent to build four whirligigs?

choices.answer: She knew he was a good carpenter.
They would help her daughter's spirit live on.
They would raise money for the church.
She wanted one for each corner of her yard.

questions.question: How did Brent judge his father's moods?

choices.answer: He listened to his father's grunts and snorts.
He looked at the lines on his father's forehead.
He watched the way his father moved his hands.
He paid attention to the way his father stood.

questions.question: Brent's parents let him go on the trip because

choices.answer: they wanted him to learn about the country.
they knew he would have a good time.
his friends wanted him to go with them.
his probation officer thought it might help.

questions.question: The street-sweeper was sad after his boat trip because

choices.answer: he didn't catch a trophy fish.
he wished he had his own boat.
he dropped his backpack overboard.
he realized shearwaters didn't live alone.

questions.question: Since they had moved to Chicago, Brent's family____________while eating.

choices.answer: talked about school.
watched television.
read the newspaper.
listened to the stereo.

questions.question: The clerk at the youth hostel

choices.answer: sent Brent to the Holiday inn.
didn't speak any English.
pretended that Brent was Canadian.
told Brent that the hostel was full.

questions.question: Alexandria thought the whirligig

choices.answer: cost more than she could afford.
was made by Native Americans.
was about one hundred years old.
represented all unseen forces.

questions.question: Brent preferred making whirligigs

choices.answer: at night in his room.
without people watching.
with the help of his father.
in front of other people.

questions.question: Brent learned that KARASS is

choices.answer: a person who travels without a particular destination.
a species of shore bird native to the Pacific Northwest.
a disparate group of people unknowingly linked together.
a carpenter's tool used to shape and smooth wood.

questions.question: Brent didn't like staying at the bed and breakfast because

choices.answer: it was much nosier than the campgrounds.
there were too many questions at dinner.
the swimming pool was out of order.
it cost more than the other motels.

questions.question: To travel around the United States, Brent

choices.answer: hitchhiked.
drove a truck.
rode a bus.
rode a bicycle.

questions.question: Alexandra planned to use guided imagery with Stephanie

choices.answer: to help Stephanie find a boyfriend.
to help Stephanie take her test.
to cure Stephanie's headaches.
to make Stephanie quit smoking.
